posts.post_content:
the remove and return effects are simultaneous. I was having an argument with a mate of mine over this in an EDH game.  
I use it with my [Reaper King](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper King) deck, you can imagine how much fun it is when they Wrath or [Bane of the Living](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bane of the Living) or something similar, and i cast Ghostway, then [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate) everything he holds dearly when they come back.

posts.post_content: **ALLIES!!** have 3 Ghostways in my maindeck, it's the usual win condition. 2 [Halimar Excavator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Halimar Excavator)s (or 1 with a [Jwari Shapeshifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jwari Shapeshifter)) and 3 other cheap allies is already a 14-29 card mill. then Ghostway for an additional 50 cards, boom! wins the same way with [Hagra Diabolist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hagra Diabolist)s, only faster and easier. throw in some [Day of Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgement) from M11 and you've got a wicked johnny deck with any color splash, thanks to [Harabaz Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harabaz Druid)s. hell of a lot cheaper than a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication) and much more versatile. **ALLIES!!**
posts.html:

ALLIES!!

Posted By: kronos539 (7/8/2010 6:57:18 PM)

posts.post_content:
Beautiful.  
  
Allies have been mentioned. This is, indeed, excellent for them. At the very least, a resolved Ghostway can lead to a [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) the next turn that leaves your Allies untouched and with their counters equalized to the number of Allies in play (meaning that all of your Allies end up with the maximum available counters allowed by your board position). At the very best, a resolved Ghostway is a one-spell finisher, milling and granting life to the hundreds with [Ondu Cleric](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ondu Cleric) and [Halimar Excavator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Halimar Excavator). Just beautiful.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: [Sudden Disappearance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sudden Disappearance) is a more powerful, higher CMC version of this - it hits artifacts, enchantments, and planeswalkers as well, plus you can blink your opponents' stuff if that would be more strategic (such as clearing blockers for an alpha strike). Still, if all you want is something to exploit enters the battlefield triggers (or just a cheaper CMC card to protect your guys from [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) effects), this card has no equal.

posts.post_content:
All of the creatures come back at the same time, and all of their comes into play abilities trigger at the same time. Since they all trigger at the same time, you get to decide the order in which they go on the stack. But all the creatures will 'see' the others. So, if you have a [Hada Freeblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hada Freeblade), [Murasa Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murasa Pyromancer), and an [Ondu Cleric](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ondu Cleric), and you use Ghostway, the interaction will go like this:   
  
Hada Freeblade gets 3 +1/+1 counters  
Murasa Pyromancer deals 9 damage (3 for when it hit the battlefield and triggered, and 3 more for each of the other two hitting the battlefield)  
Ondu Cleric gains 9 life for you (3 for itself, and 3 for each of the other 2 allies)   
  
In this case, it doesn't matter what order you put these abilities on the stack. Because all 3 creatures are on the field by the time they resolve, all of the abilities will resolve to their fullest potential.
posts.html:
All of the creatures come back at the same time, and all of their comes into play abilities trigger at the same time. Since they all trigger at the same time, you get to decide the order in which they go on the stack. But all the creatures will 'see' the others. So, if you have a Hada Freeblade, Murasa Pyromancer, and an Ondu Cleric, and you use Ghostway, the interaction will go like this:

Hada Freeblade gets 3 +1/+1 counters
Murasa Pyromancer deals 9 damage (3 for when it hit the battlefield and triggered, and 3 more for each of the other two hitting the battlefield)
Ondu Cleric gains 9 life for you (3 for itself, and 3 for each of the other 2 allies)

In this case, it doesn't matter what order you put these abilities on the stack. Because all 3 creatures are on the field by the time they resolve, all of the abilities will resolve to their fullest potential.
